name.title: Service name
name.description: The name of the service instance. The name must contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores and dashes up to a maximum of 24 characters, and must start and end with an alphanumeric character).

region.description: The Kubernetes cluster will run in this region. When no region is specified the cluster is constrained to the local region.

sleep.description: The sleep duration in seconds before tasks exit.

service_account.description: The service account for DC/OS service authentication. This is typically left empty to use the default unless service authentication is needed. The value given here is passed as the principal of the Mesos framework.

service_account_secret.title: Credential secret name (optional)
service_account_secret.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

virtual_network_name.description: The name of the DC/OS virtual network to use.

log_level.description: The log level for the DC/OS service.

use_agent_docker_certs.title: Use the agent's Docker certificates
use_agent_docker_certs.description: Whether to use the agent's Docker certificates in order to access private Docker registries.

high_availability.title: High-availability
high_availability.description: Whether to deploy a highly-available control plane.

service_cidr.title: Service CIDR
service_cidr.description: Kubernetes Service CIDR block, e.g. '10.100.0.0/16'. It MUST NOT overlap with DC/OS VIP CIDR block.

dcos_token_authentication.title: DC/OS token authentication
dcos_token_authentication.description: Whether to enable DC/OS token authentication.

proxy.title: Proxy injection configuration
proxy.description: Configure the injection of proxy settings to Kubernetes.

override_injection.description: By default agent proxy configurations are injected. This option allows for manual configuration of these proxy rules as defined in the HTTP, HTTPS and No Proxy fields. Leave these fields blank to completely disable proxy rules for Kubernetes.

http_proxy.description: http proxy server to use, leave blank if you wish to define none.

https_proxy.description: https proxy server to use, leave blank if you wish to define none.

no_proxy.description: This option is used when HTTP or HTTPS proxies are define, all entries must be separated by comma (,), cidrs must be valid, no wildcards (*)

public_node_count.description: Number of desired public Kubernetes nodes.

kube_mem.description: Amount of memory RAM resources available for pods (in MB).

kube_disk.title: Node Disk size (MB)

maximum_container_log_size.title: Maximum size for each pod's container's log file (in MB)
maximum_container_log_size.description: The maximum size (in MB) that each pod's container's log file may reach before older entries are deleted.

calico.title: Calico configuration
calico.description: Calico provides secure network connectivity for containers and virtual machine workloads.

calico_ipv4pool_cidr.description: When using Calico IPAM, each workload is assigned an address from the selection of configured IP pools. You may want to modify the IP pool of a running cluster.

cni_mtu.description: Typically the MTU for your kubernetes workload interfaces should match the network MTU. If you need IP-in-IP then the MTU size for both the workload and tunnel interfaces should be 20 bytes less than the network MTU for your network. This is due to the extra 20 byte header that the tunnel will add to each packet.

ip_autodetection_method.description: Each Kubernetes node must be configured with an IPv4 address that has access to the virtual network (as defined in option "virtual_network_name" above). Calico will autodetect these IP addresses based on the method defined here. For more information, please refer to the official documentation at docs.projectcalico.org/v3.5/reference/node/configuration#ip-autodetection-methods.

ipv4pool_ipip.description: Calico can be configured to use IP-in-IP encapsulation by enabling the IPIP option on the IP pool resource. When enabled, Calico will use IP-in-IP encapsulation when routing packets to workload IPs falling in the IP pool range.

felix_ipinipmtu.description: The MTU Calico sets on the tunnel device created in the kube-node task.

felix_ipinipenabled.description: Whether Calico should configure an IPinIP interface on the kube-node.

typha.title: Typha configuration
typha.description: Typha sits in between Felix and the Kubernetes API server, reducing Calico's load on the API server. Recommended when deploying Kubernetes cluster with more than 50 nodes.

enabled.description: Whether to enable Calico Typha deployment. Recommended when deploying Kubernetes cluster with more than 50 nodes.

replicas.description: Number of Typha replicas. We recommend using Typha if you have more than 50 nodes. Above 100 nodes it is essential. Use one replica for every 100-200 nodes. In production, we recommend running at least 3 replicas to reduce the impact of rolling upgrade.

data_disk.title: Disk size (MB) for data
data_disk.description: etcd node persistent disk requirements (in MB) for the data

wal_disk.title: Disk size (MB) for logs
wal_disk.description: etcd node persistent disk requirements (in MB) for the logs

disk_type.title: Disk type [ROOT, MOUNT]
disk_type.description: Mount volumes require pre-configuration in DC/OS.
